Class DoDClient

  • java.lang.Object
    • Client
      • DoDClient
  • public class DoDClient
extends Client
    This class represents a type of client, a DoDClient.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field Description
      private java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​GameLogic> ongoingGames
      HashMap with a String representing the clientID and a GameLogic instance representing the game they are playing

        serverIn, serverOut, socket

      The constructor initialises userInput, socket (after validation), serverIn and serverOut.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      SenderType clientType()
      Implementation of the abstract method which returns the client type.
      private java.lang.String createNewGame​(java.lang.String clientID)
      Creates a new GameLogic instance and stores it in the HashMap as the value for the clientID (which is the key)
      private void dealWithServerMsg​(java.lang.String[] serverMsg)
      Depending on the serverMsg, this will either start a new game for the given clientID or attempt to input the clientID's request into the DoD game, and will send a String reply to the server
      void go()
      Implementation of the abstract method which is how the DoDClient should run.
      static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
      The main method, creates an instance of DoDClient using console arguments as input for portString and address ("14001" and "localhost" are defaults respectively) and calls the go method
      private void mainLoop()
      Keeps reading the data received from the server, processing the data and if necessary then replying to the server This only stops if an IOException is thrown (if the server is forcibly closed) or if the serverMsg is null, which occurs if the server closed peacefully.
      private void sendToServer​(java.lang.String clientID, java.lang.String gameResponse)
      Sends the gameResponse to the server, directed to reach only the client the given clientID

    • Field Detail

      • ongoingGames

        private final java.util.HashMap<java.lang.String,​GameLogic> ongoingGames
        HashMap with a String representing the clientID and a GameLogic instance representing the game they are playing

    • Constructor Detail

      • DoDClient

        public DoDClient​(java.lang.String consoleAddress,
                 java.lang.String consolePort)
        The constructor initialises userInput, socket (after validation), serverIn and serverOut. It then sends the server a message informing it which type of client it is.
        Parameters:
        consoleAddress - String representing the address entered into the console (default is "localhost" if none was entered)
        consolePort - String representing the port number entered into the console (default is "14001" if none was entered)

    • Method Detail

      • main

        public static void main​(java.lang.String[] args)
        The main method, creates an instance of DoDClient using console arguments as input for portString and address ("14001" and "localhost" are defaults respectively) and calls the go method
        Parameters:
        args - arguments received from commandline

      • go

        public void go()
        Implementation of the abstract method which is how the DoDClient should run. It runs the main loop which deals with reading from and writing to the server, and once the main loop is broken from, the BufferedReaders are closed and then the socket is closed.
        Specified by:
        go in class Client

      • mainLoop

        private void mainLoop()
               throws java.io.IOException
        Keeps reading the data received from the server, processing the data and if necessary then replying to the server This only stops if an IOException is thrown (if the server is forcibly closed) or if the serverMsg is null, which occurs if the server closed peacefully.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the server is closed forcibly

      • dealWithServerMsg

        private void dealWithServerMsg​(java.lang.String[] serverMsg)
        Depending on the serverMsg, this will either start a new game for the given clientID or attempt to input the clientID's request into the DoD game, and will send a String reply to the server
        Parameters:
        serverMsg - String[] that consists of "clientID + ' ' + message" or "newGame + ' ' + clientID"

      • sendToServer

        private void sendToServer​(java.lang.String clientID,
                          java.lang.String gameResponse)
        Sends the gameResponse to the server, directed to reach only the client the given clientID
        Parameters:
        clientID - String representing the client's ID on the server
        gameResponse - String representing the output from the DoD game

      • createNewGame

        private java.lang.String createNewGame​(java.lang.String clientID)
        Creates a new GameLogic instance and stores it in the HashMap as the value for the clientID (which is the key)
        Parameters:
        clientID - String representing the client's ID on the server
        Returns:
        String to return to the server

      • clientType

        public SenderType clientType()
        Implementation of the abstract method which returns the client type.
        Specified by:
        clientType in class Client
        Returns:
        senderType senderType.DoDBot which represents the type of the client is DoDClient
